subject: Re: Paul's keyboard proposal (withdrawn)
msgSnippet: Thanks for the vote of confidence Paul! I have updated my spreadsheet and shown where there is agreement and where disagreement so one can concentrate the mind
messageBody:
Thanks for the vote of confidence Paul!

I have updated my spreadsheet and shown where there is agreement and
where disagreement so one can concentrate the mind on only the
contentious ones.

I have also included ALL the half letters as there are sufficient keys
available to accommodate them all.

Moira


--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "Ted Larson Freeman"
<freeman@...> wrote:
>
> Thanks, Paul. I've removed your proposal from the spreadsheet
> 'qs_keybd_proposals.csv'. Moira, would you be willing to update your
> spreadsheet? There have been changes to several of the proposals since
> you uploaded your file. Thanks.
>
> Ted
>
> PS. Moira, I just noticed that the characters for #42-44 in the Jerome
> mapping weren't preserved correctly when you made your spreadsheet
> (#41 is okay). Sorry about that. Just in case we needed another
> demonstration that such assignments should be avoided, here it is.
>
>
> On Dec 30, 2007 6:17 PM, Paul Tremblay <phthenry@...> wrote:
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > After adding the optional letters to my proposal (below), I want to
> > withdraw my proposal in favor of Moira's, which I found in the nice
> > spreadsheet she made, and which quite frankly is better than mine.
> >
> > Paul
> >
<>
